instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3437: What is 820-3437? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.SMC_TCK: What is SMC_TCK? SMC_TCK is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TDI: What is SMC_TDI? SMC_TDI is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TMS: What is SMC_TMS? SMC_TMS is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .
definitions.SMC_TDO: What is SMC_TDO? SMC_TDO is a signal that must be pulled up to 3.42v in order for the SMC to be in the proper mode to function. Often this is not pulled up because of corrosion or corroded resistors by the SMC. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Problems
threads.message: So I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> board with no green/orange magsafe, but I have PP3V42, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.18V and <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is at 3.3V. There was corrosion on L5001 which resulted in loss of pads, had to run a wire to <RESISTOR>R5193</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R5177</RESISTOR> & <RESISTOR>R5178</RESISTOR>. Before I repaired traces I powered on board and got fan spin. After I get intermittent light but PPBUS is 8.18V. I checked SDA/SCL and they are at 3.3V. Is the next logical step to go after the SMC? I tried a gentle reflow but that didn't change anything. I'm wondering if I should just reball it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Problems
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> voltage disconnecting LIO flex.
Did you have 8.18V before runing the wire?
Post exact diode mode readings on SCL/SDA lines.

Do you have now high level on all 4 <SIGNAL>SMC_TXX</SIGNAL> lines?
I recommend you to reball SMC; because of so close corrosion...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Problems
threads.message: Yeah I believe it was 8.18V before wires but I do not remember. Going to reball SMC. Already started before I saw your reply. I will post back what happens...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Problems
threads.message:
Ok, so I reballed and replaced the SMC. 

<SIGNAL>SMC_TMS</SIGNAL> - 3.42V
<SIGNAL>SMC_TDO</SIGNAL> - 3.42V
<SIGNAL>SMC_TDI</SIGNAL>  -  3.42V
<SIGNAL>SMC_TCK</SIGNAL> - 3.42V

SDA and SCL lines are at .537 on diode mode. PPBUS is still 8.17 but I now have a green light on the charger.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Problems
threads.message:
Machine still doesn't start, nor even in SMC bypass?
You should try another SMC.
Test first disconnecting BIL connector.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Problems
threads.message: I'll have to try SMC Bypass. What is a BIL connector? pardon my ingnorance.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Problems
threads.message: Sorry, I've got confused with another post about 3115 board; no BIL connector on 3437.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3437</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Problems
